2D1.1.title: Unlawful Manufacturing, Importing, Exporting, or Trafficking

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the defendant convicted of an offense under 21 U.S.C. § 841?

yesResult.description: Conviction under 21 U.S.C. § 841

noResult.description: Default base offense level for drug trafficking offenses

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What is the applicable base offense level based on conviction or stipulation?

options.label: Level 43: Convicted under 21 U.S.C. § 841(b)(1)(A)/(B)/(C) or § 960(b)(1)/(2)/(3) with mandatory life imprisonment, or parties stipulate to such offense/level
Level 38: Convicted under 21 U.S.C. § 841(b)(1)(A)/(B)/(C) or § 960(b)(1)/(2)/(3) with 20 years to life imprisonment, or parties stipulate to such offense/level
Level 30: Convicted under 21 U.S.C. § 841(b)(1)(E) or § 960(b)(5) with 30-year maximum imprisonment, or parties stipulate to such offense/level
Level 26: Convicted under 21 U.S.C. § 841(b)(1)(E) or § 960(b)(5) with 15-year maximum imprisonment, or parties stipulate to such offense/level
Drug Quantity Table applies: Use offense level specified in Drug Quantity Table
options.description: Refer to Drug Quantity Table in subsection (c)

2D1.10.title: Endangering Human Life While Illegally Manufacturing a Controlled

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is 3 plus the offense level from the Drug Quantity Table in §2D1.1 greater than 20?

yesResult.description: 3 plus the offense level from the Drug Quantity Table in §2D1.1

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the manufacture of amphetamine or methamphetamine, and if so, did it create a substantial risk of harm to the life of a minor or an incompetent?

options.label: No manufacture of amphetamine or methamphetamine
Manufacture of amphetamine or methamphetamine (no substantial risk to minor/incompetent)
Manufacture of amphetamine or methamphetamine AND created substantial risk of harm to life of minor or incompetent

2D1.11.title: Unlawfully Distributing, Importing, Exporting or Possessing a Listed Chemical;

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve unlawfully manufacturing a controlled substance, or attempting to manufacture a controlled substance unlawfully, and would applying §2D1.1 result in a greater offense level than determined by this guideline?

yesResult.description: Cross reference to §2D1.1 for unlawful manufacturing

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine (use subsection (d) table)?
Is the quantity 9 KG or more of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?
Does the defendant receive an adjustment under §3B1.2 (Mitigating Role)?

yesResult.description: Level 38 decreased by 4 levels for mitigating role

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 3 KG but less than 9 KG of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?
Does the defendant receive an adjustment under §3B1.2 (Mitigating Role)?

yesResult.description: Level 36 decreased by 3 levels for mitigating role

noResult.description: At least 3 KG but less than 9 KG of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 1 KG but less than 3 KG of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?
Does the defendant receive an adjustment under §3B1.2 (Mitigating Role)?

yesResult.description: Level 34 decreased by 3 levels for mitigating role

noResult.description: At least 1 KG but less than 3 KG of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 300 G but less than 1 KG of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?
Does the defendant receive an adjustment under §3B1.2 (Mitigating Role)?

yesResult.description: Level 32 decreased by 2 levels for mitigating role

noResult.description: At least 300 G but less than 1 KG of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 100 G but less than 300 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 100 G but less than 300 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 70 G but less than 100 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 70 G but less than 100 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 40 G but less than 70 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 40 G but less than 70 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 10 G but less than 40 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 10 G but less than 40 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 8 G but less than 10 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 8 G but less than 10 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 6 G but less than 8 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 6 G but less than 8 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 4 G but less than 6 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 4 G but less than 6 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 2 G but less than 4 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 2 G but less than 4 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the quantity at least 1 G but less than 2 G of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, or phenylpropanolamine?

yesResult.description: At least 1 G but less than 2 G of ephedrine/pseudoephedrine/phenylpropanolamine

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I chemicals meeting the highest quantity thresholds (e.g., 2.7 KG or more of Benzaldehyde, 33 KG or more of Acetic Anhydride, etc.) per level 30 in table (e)(1)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the second-highest quantity thresholds per level 28 in table (e)(2)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at second-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the third-highest quantity thresholds per level 26 in table (e)(3)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at third-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the fourth-highest quantity thresholds per level 24 in table (e)(4)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at fourth-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the fifth-highest quantity thresholds per level 22 in table (e)(5)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at fifth-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the sixth-highest quantity thresholds per level 20 in table (e)(6)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at sixth-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the seventh-highest quantity thresholds per level 18 in table (e)(7)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at seventh-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the eighth-highest quantity thresholds per level 16 in table (e)(8)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at eighth-highest threshold quantities

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve List I or List II chemicals meeting the ninth-highest quantity thresholds per level 14 in table (e)(9) (including 3.6 KG or more of Anthranilic Acid or 4.8 KG or more of N-Acetylanthranilic Acid)?

yesResult.description: List I or List II chemicals at ninth-highest threshold quantities

noResult.description: List I or List II chemicals below all higher thresholds

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was a dangerous weapon (including a firearm) possessed?

2D1.12.title: Unlawful Possession, Manufacture, Distribution, Transportation, Exportation,

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant intend to manufacture a controlled substance, or know or believe the prohibited flask, equipment, chemical, product, or material was to be used to manufacture a controlled substance?

yesResult.description: Intent or knowledge regarding controlled substance manufacturing

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant have reasonable cause to believe the prohibited flask, equipment, chemical, product, or material was to be used to manufacture a controlled substance?

yesResult.description: Reasonable cause to believe materials would be used for controlled substance manufacturing

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant intend to manufacture methamphetamine, or know/believe/have reasonable cause to believe the prohibited flask, equipment, chemical, product, or material was to be used to manufacture methamphetamine?
Did the offense involve unlawful discharge/emission/release of hazardous substances into the environment OR unlawful transportation/treatment/storage/disposal of hazardous waste?

yesEffect.description: Environmental hazard or hazardous waste violations

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant (or person for whose conduct defendant is accountable) distribute prohibited materials through mass-marketing by means of an interactive computer service?

yesEffect.description: Mass-marketing distribution through interactive computer service

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve stealing anhydrous ammonia or transporting stolen anhydrous ammonia?

yesEffect.description: Stealing or transporting stolen anhydrous ammonia

2D1.13.title: Structuring Chemical Transactions or Creating a Chemical Mixture to Evade

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant know or believe that the chemical was to be used to manufacture a controlled substance unlawfully?

yesResult.description: Apply the offense level from §2D1.11 (includes base offense level and any applicable specific offense characteristics or cross references)

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant have reason to believe that the chemical was to be used to manufacture a controlled substance unlawfully?

yesResult.description: Apply the offense level from §2D1.11 reduced by 3 levels

noResult.description: Base offense level 6 applies when defendant neither knew/believed nor had reason to believe the chemical would be used unlawfully

2D1.2.title: Drug Offenses Occurring Near Protected Locations or Involving Underage or

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve a person less than eighteen years of age?

yesResult.description: Offense involved person under 18 years of age

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense directly involve controlled substances in connection with a protected location or an underage or pregnant individual?
What is the offense level from §2D1.1 for the quantity of controlled substances directly involving the protected location or underage/pregnant individual?

result.description: 2 plus offense level from §2D1.1 for protected location/underage/pregnant individual quantity

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Are there controlled substances involved in the offense beyond those directly involving a protected location or underage/pregnant individual?
What is the offense level from §2D1.1 for the total quantity of controlled substances involved in the offense?

result.description: 1 plus offense level from §2D1.1 for total quantity of controlled substances

2D1.5.title: Continuing Criminal Enterprise; Attempt or Conspiracy

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the base offense level of 38 greater than 4 plus the offense level from §2D1.1 applicable to the underlying offense?

yesResult.description: Level 38 applies as the greater of the two options

noResult.description: 4 plus the offense level from §2D1.1 applicable to the underlying offense

2D1.6.title: Use of Communication Facility in Committing Drug Offense; Attempt or

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this a violation of 21 U.S.C. § 848 (Continuing Criminal Enterprise)?

yesResult.description: Continuing Criminal Enterprise under 21 U.S.C. § 848

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply - different offense type

2D1.9.title: Placing or Maintaining Dangerous Devices on Federal Property to Protect the

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the offense involve assembling, placing, causing to be placed, or maintaining a dangerous device (booby-trap) on federal property where a controlled substance is being manufactured or distributed?

yesResult.description: Placing or maintaining dangerous devices on federal property to protect unlawful production of controlled substances

noResult.description: This guideline does not apply to this offense

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is this offense covered by §2D1.1 (Unlawful Manufacturing, Importing, Exporting, or Trafficking; Attempt or Conspiracy)?

noResult.description: Default base offense level when §2D1.1 does not apply

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does the underlying offense qualify for §2D1.1(a)(5)(A) or §2D1.1(a)(5)(B) provisions?

yesResult.description: §2D1.1(a)(5)(A) and (a)(5)(B) provisions are excluded, use alternative base level

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Can you determine the appropriate offense level from the §2D1.1 drug quantity table for the underlying offense?

yesResult.description: Apply the offense level from §2D1.1 corresponding to the underlying drug offense

noResult.description: Default base offense level when §2D1.1 level cannot be determined

2D2.3.title: Operating or Directing the Operation of a Common Carrier Under the

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this case involve simple possession of a controlled substance under 21 U.S.C. § 844(a)?

yesResult.description: Simple possession of controlled substance (subject to statutory minimums under 21 U.S.C. § 844(a))
